seo.title: Day Trips from Positano: Capri, Pompeii, Ravello, Amalfi
seo.description: How to plan popular day trips from Positano with ferries and buses, including timing and ticket tips.

linkLabel: Best Day Trips: Capri, Amalfi, Pompeii & More
intro: Use Positano as a base for day trips by ferry and bus—start early, pre-book key tickets, and always carry a weather fallback.

sections.title: Capri highlights
body: Book the first ferry out, ride the chairlift to Monte Solaro, and stroll Giardini di Augusto before cruise visitors arrive.
Return on a late-afternoon sailing and keep a bus timetable screenshot in case seas get rough.

sections.title: Pompeii or Herculaneum
body: Take the early bus to Sorrento and connect with the Circumvesuviana train; buy skip-the-line tickets online to save time.
Carry water and a sun hat—there is little shade on site, and visits easily run 3–4 hours.

sections.title: Amalfi & Ravello combo
body: Sail to Amalfi, explore the Duomo, then ride the 5110 bus up to Ravello for Villa Cimbrone and lunch with a view.
Stay for late-afternoon light and catch a twilight ferry or bus back—queues shrink after 18:00.

sections.title: Sorrento & food focus
body: Hop on the mid-morning ferry to Sorrento for a market crawl, limoncello tastings, and sunset at the Villa Comunale terrace.
Return via late bus to Positano if the last ferry sells out; the ride takes about 50 minutes.

tips: Pre-load offline maps and timetables; mobile data can dip inside train tunnels and on the Capri cliffs.
Pack a lightweight rain jacket—summer storms roll in fast and ferries pause during lightning.

faqs.q: Which day trip needs the earliest start?
a: Capri and Pompeii benefit from first departures; they get crowded by mid-morning and involve more travel time.

faqs.q: Can I fit two towns into one day?
a: Yes—pair Amalfi with Ravello or Sorrento with Pompeii. Avoid stacking Capri with anything else; give it a full day.
